Reviews.Title: don't buy - and if you do buy get the extended warranty
Reviews.Author: R. McDowell
Reviews.Content: Mine blew a few weeks out of warranty.  I have never had that happen with any other tv i've owned.  They usually fail right away or last.  This one started flashing like a strobe at us.  I called Vizio and they refused to accept any responsibility even after admitting it was a manufacturing defect.  They did offer to repair it for $99 but would not guarantee that the repair would work.  Will the repair guy shows up, looks at the tv and says he can't fiix it.  So on top of the dead set i am out another $99 believing they would make some effort to fix it.  Then they offered to sell me a reconditioned one for just about full price if i would give mine back, so they could recondition it and sell it some other sucker.Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Great contrast ratio, lots of features, best price!
Reviews.Author: John A. Mickus
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research among 55" TVs, specifically LED.  I looked at some higher-priced units that have premium "Edge-Lit" LED tech, but I also read that could be less reliable and usually has slightly less contrast ratio.I'm very very happy with my choice, and all the features work wonderfully.The smart-dimming feature ended up annoying me, but it's pretty easy to turn it off through the settings menu.Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: A few hiccups but for $479, a lot of value for my dollars.
Reviews.Author: Noe Gomez
Reviews.Content: I got the Vizio E550i-A0 this week after purchasing on Thanksgiving day. I thought it was a great deal for $479 (+CA tax and $5 enviornment fee).Skip first paragraph if you don't want to hear about how unsatisfied I am with Delivery.First I want to say that I am a little upset at Amazon and there Delivery partner in my area CEVA. I have prime and I had set up a delivery for Saturday morning. Friday night I receive a call from CEVA telling me that the TV hadn't arrived and that it would arrive on monday night and shipped out on tuesday. I am not sure if it was AMAZON's fault (their page showed item as delivered to CEVA) or CEVA's fault, but that took away the convinience of schedule delivery promoted by AMAZON Prime. Ok, just wanted to mention that. Now on to TV.Took TV out of Box and I loved how it really had a thin Bezel. Vizio promotes this and even though it isn't extremelly flat all around, the thin bezel makes the screen look bigger than a 55". Package came with screws screwdirver to install the included stand. It wasn't difficult but you might need help lifting TV and resting it on its screen side to install the stand.Setting the TV took around 10 min. Took me around that time because I wrote my info to register the TV with VIZIO, and this takes a little while going through letters and numbers with the remote.HDMI and other video inputs are on the back and on the side. I really love the side inputs because they help delete clotter from the back if you're putting next to a wall.The picture did look good but it was not what I expected (and have seen 120hz) do. VIZIO promotes this TV as a 120hz Effective refresh rate and it actually acts more like a 60hz. Not sure if I am suppose to do something to make the Effective Refresh kick in, but to me it just seems like VIZIO lied in this department. But besides that, picture looks great and again thanks to thin Bezel, screen looks great.I really loved that the tV came with smart apps, it made the value even greater. The first app I tried was Netflix and it just kept giving me an error that it couldnt connect and to try going to netflix.com/help (i think). On that site, Netflix suggest to unplug tv for certain time and plug it in and try netflix again. The other one is: While on the netflix app (showing error message), press the following on your remote, Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, Up, Up, Up, Up. This will bring up a "secret" option that displays a "Deactivate" button. Choose "Deactivate" and press OK. Get out of the netflix app and open the app again. This allowed me to get into netflix and log in. I actually tried the second method first and it worked. That is the only app I have used so far.I am not expert when it comes to TV settings but I did feel that the TV could look a little better, so I looked around for picture settings. Unfortunately there isn't many setting available from major review sites besides CNET and reviewers like ourselves. I actually used the settings that someone posted on this site for an A1 series tv (because there were non specifically for my E550 A0. Also, CNEt says that any settings you find for the following tvs, will work well with any of them since they all have around the same mechanics. The TV list are:Models in seriesVizio E390i-A1  39 inchesVizio E420i-A1 (reviewed)  42 inchesVizio E420i-A0  42 inchesVizio E470i-A1  47 inchesVizio E470i-A0  47 inchesVizio E500i-A1 (reviewed)  50 inchesVizio E550i-A0  55 inchesand the setting that I used (again from someone who reviewed in AMAZON) are:---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 53Brightness: 50Contrast: 75Color: 51Tint: 0Sharpness: 0---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: NormalRed Gain: 104Green Gain: 115Blue gain: 130Red offset: 129Green offset: 130Blue offset: 132--Advanced Picture submenu---Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: OffFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: OffAmbient Light sensor: OffAll in all, for the price I paid during thanksgiving sale, I believe I got a lot of value for my money. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: The best purchase ever
Reviews.Author: Edin Heric
Reviews.Content: Amazing TV, great picture, great features. I don't think I have ever been as satisfied with the purchase made, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Solid Purchase
Reviews.Author: Stuart Thomason
Reviews.Content: Light, very easy to install, excellent picture quality. Setup was typical and easy.  Terrific value.Why only 4 stars?  It has to do with the software driving the apps for the Smart TV part of it.  I like how they keep a portion of the screen available for continuing watching TV while you're searching, but the app portion is tight.  Searching for movies is a bit cumbersome and inefficient, something that might be better with a little more real estate. I hope Vizio invests in improvements that users can download later.  (Amazon Prime was noticeably more annoying than Netflix to use.)The TV doesn't always get the HDMI signal to my receiver correctly (or maybe my receiving is the problem, dunno.)  Anyhow, it requires me to switch my receiver to another input and then back to the TV, and most of the time it fixes it on the first try, but two to three times isn't unusual.After having it for a couple of months now, I would definitely purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level LED with minor bugs
Reviews.Author: michael J.
Reviews.Content: I was excited to upgrade to this LED from a 42" LCD.  We mainly use it for movies and gamingThis TV has a great picture, especially with games. With blurays, the picture is pretty sharp,however there was some motion blur in there. Especially darker/indoor scenes so I would say it's not a true 120hz. One downside is viewing angles. To get a superb picture/color, you must be in front of it. I have chair offside in living room & you can see the picture well but the colors are completely off. Another reason I got the smart TV is because smart TV's have usb media playback. Every file I tried to play would play halfway through, regardless of length, and stop and return to media menu. Then press play again, with no option to play from previous point. Vizio customer service was great, they offered to ship a new remote to try, but still the same issue after that.I contacted Amazon & their customer service is awesome. Due to TV acting up & being out of stock of these vizio models (55 & 60), they have shipped the TV of my choice.This time around, I chose a samsung smart TV, as that model was in stock & had stellar reviews.I recommend Amazon because of their high customer satisfaction

Reviews.Title: Video and Audio problems.
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Conklin
Reviews.Content: Both the video and audio on my set keep cutting out. It seems to happen after the set has been on for more that an hour. I called Vizio they suggested I reset the TV. I did that and the set was okay for a couple of days and then it started to lose the audio and video again. The set is being returned.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: jahkaz
Reviews.Content: great price. great picture. USB conx plays passport/flash based .avi/mp4 videos.  youtube/Netflix/etc internet/wireless real easy to setup.  only complaint is the number buttons on remote for selecting channels are a little small.  5 x HDMI conx's??? who's gonna use that many!bezel is nice and thin also

Reviews.Title: Above and Beyond
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased to TV awhile ago. We have always loved Vizio and Samsung TV's so it was a no brainer that we were gonna get one of those brands. We saw this TV, and thought it was an outstanding price for the size. Little did we know what exactly a smart TV was. When we got home, we were dumb founded at the features it had. We will NEVER go back to just a plain flat screen. Netflix is an easy connect and stream for movies, amazon easy to use on it, we don't use the e-mail feature on it though.The picture is great, clear and crisp. Sound is great, you don't have to adjust too much in between dialogue and action, it automatically does it for you. Would recommend to anyone and everyone. This television goes above and beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: GREAT !!! Love IT!
Reviews.Author: JR Big Boy
Reviews.Content: It's big...very big. 4 feet across. The picture is beautiful. Movies are crystal clear. Gaming is awesome. HD TV is fantastic. It was very easy to hang on the wall. Not very heavy. Lots of inputs to use. Internet ready with WIFI. When Netflix played on TV the sound is played back through HDMI cable to my sound system. Great option.But it!

Reviews.Title: Deceptive delivery trick
Reviews.Author: Randy M. Hall
Reviews.Content: I can not rate the TV itself because it never worked due to shipping damage but based on other reviews I have read, maybe it was a blessing in disguise. I got this as a lightning deal for a great price and although I selected my desired delivery date at purchase time, that date was changed for some reason. I was excited for the TV to arrive and read on Amazon's site about what to expect and do when it arrived. I live in the northeast and it was winter so the temps were cold on delivery day. Amazon's site says not to turn the TV on until it has had time to come up to room temperature when outside temps are cold. Here is where the deceptive part comes in; when the delivery guys came and brought the box into my house, the guy asked that I not unpack the TV for 30 minutes due to the temp difference indoors/outdoors. I did not really think too much about it because it was similar advice as given on Amazon's site. Shortly after the delivery service left, I began to think about what they said and thought why can't I unpack it? As long as I don't plug it in for 30 minutes, I should still be able to unpack it. So, I opened the box and pulled the TV out. When the TV slid out, I noticed some white foam pieces came out as well. I thought, not good, those foam pieces were supposed to protect the TV. I then noticed the TV bezel around the screen had damage. Now I can't say for sure but it seems to me the delivery guys told me not to unpack it for 30 minutes instead of just not to plug it in for 30 minutes because they knew the box had been dropped and the TV might be damaged. I immediately called Amazon customer service and they asked me to plug the TV in and see if it worked. No joy, the TV would only display a blue screen. I was bummed out when the customer service rep told me I could not get a replacement because they were sold out. I have to give Amazon customer service 5 stars for their assistance and for taking the TV back and issuing a full refund.Lesson learned, make sure items are unpacked and checked for damage before signing anything and letting the delivery service leave. I say this because it's not fair that Amazon probably ate the damaged TV when the shipping company should have been held liable.

Reviews.Title: Buttons on side of tv stopped working
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The buttons on side of tv and volume control on remote intermittently stopped working. we would then have to turn off tv, wait a few minutes and turn it back on to adjust volume. We got this at a great price on a lightening deal. We were thrilled until we started having this issue after 2 weeks. Amazon was great with letting us exchange this tv for a similiar tv since amazon no longer sells this tv. They shipped us new tv in 2 days and picked up broken tv at no additional cost. Im very impressed with amazon, extremely disappointed with vizio and this tv.

Reviews.Title: Do Not buy this TV
Reviews.Author: Vontrell D Salter
Reviews.Content: Manufacturers are now being misleading about the refresh rates of tvs. I bought mine for 500 on a Black Friday sale and I am still disappointed as will you if you buy it. I am returning mine. This tv does not have the smooth motion or depth that a true 120hz can provide. My other hd tv looks way better. Others giving a high rating are either lying or don't  know any better.. Research fake refresh rates. I gave one star because I feel lied to. Which I was...

Reviews.Title: Happy with the TV, Amazon delivery needs work. (Update TV Failed after 2 months)
Reviews.Author: Nicholas WHammerschmidt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit October 1. It took 9 days for the TV to get here and was sold as having "enhanced delivery". This apparently means that they bring the TV in and make sure it works. They DO NOT put the TV on the TV stand or connect any cable other than the power cord. The "enhanced" part only seemed to be for Amazon's benefit only. I would have preferred they just leave it at the door instead of the half unboxed mess they left behind.The TV installed quickly and so far I am thrilled with the picture and sound quality. Didn't think I would use the Smart TV features, but I have been streaming Amazon on Demand all day.For $698, you really cannot go wrong with this set.*****UPDATE 12/4/2013********The TV broke two weeks ago, Called Vizio service and I am still waiting on a replacement. Scheduled for delivery on Tuesday which will make 2 and a half weeks without a TV.

Reviews.Title: Viewing only good in front of TV
Reviews.Author: Ken Maynard
Reviews.Content: If you sit only slightly to the side of the TV, the picture quality diminishes greatly. Terrible for a room where people are sitting around the TV.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY AN E-SERIES TV!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Skipper McFearson "quickcuda6"
Reviews.Content: The E series means "economy".  Economy parts, economy operation and economy service.  My 50" E series died after 7 months (picture just failed and would not come back on).  The remote is absolutely horrible - you have to press the buttons so hard that it hurts the fingers.  The glare from any ambient light is horrible.  The connections are awful - my Optical connector will not even stay in place, it just falls out.  The part to repair my TV is on back order with no estimates for delivery or repair.  I am fully expecting to take a $600.00 bath on this P.O.S.  The people who rave about Vizio being all that apparently don't set the bar very high.

Reviews.Title: Looks great....wireless may be a lttle weak
Reviews.Author: Robert J Weaver
Reviews.Content: Bought the 55" to replace a 52 and was a little worried about it fitting in my entertainment system.....no issues!  The "almost" frameless design of this TV made it about the identical size of the 52.  Picture looks great, vivd colors and the LED makes the darker movies and blacks/greys on the screen look much better than the LCD.  Jury is still out on the "Smart" part of this TV.  Setup was easy but checked out by watching some Netflix movies and it ended up buffering several times through the movies.  I have a STRONG wireless setup so this shouldn't be happening.  Hooked a Blue Ray player with Netflix to the TV and watched movies without a single buffering episode.  Cannot find out where the wireless card is in the TV so really can't move it around to see if it will get a better signal.  Audio is much better than expected since there are no speakers on the front.  Still, big improvement over the more expensive 52" LCD that it replaced.

Reviews.Title: They are throwing TVs with super fragile panel.
Reviews.Author: MAK
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV from from Amazon during 2013 Black Friday deals. TV was certainly good for the money I paid, but definitely not great. In about a months time we moved to another place, which is merely 3 blocks away from my old place and then the TV wouldn't turn on. Checked with Vizio and they diagnosed that LCD panel is broken and understandably not covered under warranty. We took all the precautions, packed it in the box the way it was delivered to us. and was on the vehicle for only 3 blocks, thats less than 3 minutes but it broke. I have heard before about black friday deal TV's being not exactly the same TV as the ones being sold during normal days, and this proves to me. I was planning to buy Vizio soundbar system, but I am done with Vizio for good. This has shaken my confidence in Amazon, especially for buying expensive stuffs.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Unisa
Reviews.Content: Poorly made... The features of this "smart" tv weren't made very well.  The remote needs to be pointed directly at the sensor.  Point it even an inch away from the sensor and it doesn't work.  The V.I.A. feature is the worst thing about this tv.  At first I would press the button and the menu came up maybe 50% of the time, but now for some reason I need to press the menu button then the V.I.A. button and MAYBE it would come up.  The USB menu is sloppy.  Sorting from A-Z makes weird groups.  It makes multiple groups of A-Z.  The worst part is I never know which video files will work.  MP4 files are supposed to play on this tv, but some work and some don't.  If Vizio would've just cleaned up the features I would've given this tv 5 stars...

Reviews.Title: Very good tv with only a couple of draw backs
Reviews.Author: mg
Reviews.Content: We were one of the lucky ones to pick this up on black friday for the sub $500 price, with that alone it is crazy how nice this tv is for how cheap we got it. Now I have noticed some things about it that if I was paying full price might make me want to check out other tvs.First the plastic housing is cheap looking and feeling, from the side and back. The front looks good which is what really matters. Also when you pick it up it flexes and creeks. I have had it shut off on me now out of nowhere twice. I dont know if thats a thing with these but hopefully it wont get worse. I have also seen some choppy panning, this has been while watching netflix not cable nor bluray so i am more apt to blame it on the netflix, although lots of people do say it is a stretch to label this tv as 120 hz. The smart menu also has quite a bit of lag when opening it up. The stock color settings are terrible especially the reds, and i am no videophile. This takes some time to get right through hit and miss calibration, and even when it is calibrated you are left with good not spectacular colors. Now even with that being said I still really like this tv. The smart features are great. It is plug and play after the initial set up to wifi. The internal wifi is also nice. The 4 hdmi inputs are more that what i would ever need, and the usb input is very nice for getting avi movies on thumb drives from friends.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 4 Life
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable value for this set. Payed $670 for this TV and am really happy with it. This is my first Vizio and I'm very impressed with the picture, sound and design. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Vizio is selling defective products and then has terrible customer service to back them up
Reviews.Author: M. Lane "DogtorM"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a lightning deal, and was very pleased when I first set it up. However, within 24 hours, different areas of the screen started flashing/shadowing. I called Vizio, and they had me go through several steps which included disconnecting everything from the TV, unplugging, waiting, etc... The flashing admittedly improved, but a shadow remained across the bottom of the screen. They asked me to send them pictures, so I sent 3. They claimed they could only see the problem in one, so they asked for more pictures. Reading through other reviews, I noted one reviewer talked about similar problems with his TV, and others within a range of serial #'s. I looked, and mine landed within that range. Vizio said they have no knowledge of such a problem.I've had several frustrating calls with Vizio with tremendous hold times (15+ minutes). Fortunately, Amazon customer service is taking care of me as always. They plan on sending a replacement when it comes back in stock or giving me a full refund. All in all, it's just another case of "you get what you pay for". I have a sneaking suspicion that, unbeknownst to amazon, Vizio sent a bunch of defective TV's for the lightning deal.

Reviews.Title: Plagued with blue ghosting and chromatic abrasion
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: I fot this tv at a great price for black friday.  the picture had Blue ghosting around dark objects similar to chromatic abrasion in photography. I exchanged the TV for a different one and the second tv had the same problem. The only saving grace was that amazon took care of me every step of the way and I'm now the owner of a Samsung 55" TV.  I will not be buying another Visio which is sad because I had a Visio before and loved it.  Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, quality is inconsistent among panels
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Black Friday. As soon as I turned it on the first time, I knew something was "off".The colors were atrocious, and the menu had a purplish hue. After changing the color temperature, I got the colors to look decent. But playing video games was a disaster, as moving the camera in games with dark textures (Skyrim, Deus Ex: Human Revolution, Dark Souls, etc.) caused a very distracting and noticeable color smear across the entire screen. In addition, it had horrible flashlighting in all four corners of the screen (large light leaks that are noticeable during dark scenes in movies/games).Thankfully, Vizio agreed it was a problem and shipped a replacement. The new panel doesn't have any problems of the first--in fact, it looks great! But I've noticed it's actually not as bright as the first panel. Still, a small price to pay to have a working set.I also subtracted a star because Vizio flat-out lied about this television's refresh rate. It is NOT 120hz, and there are no options to turn on motion smoothing. I actually like having slight motion smoothing, so I was disappointed to find out that this TV doesn't support it. Shame on Vizio for misleading customers like that, but kudos for promptly replacing my defective TV.

Reviews.Title: Works Great with a few Major Quirks
Reviews.Author: Steven Cates
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that I purchased the 55 inch E550i-A0 Model. I received it on time and the shippers were kind enough at going through the checklist for everything. 100 % functional, good so far.The first quirk I noticed was with the quality of the build. The plastic felt cheap and weak, and at times when moving it felt like the whole thing was held together by glue. But of course this IS the budget model from Vizio, so that is understandable. What was NOT ok was that whenever I moved the TV and gently shook it, the screen itself moved between the plastic as if it was not anchored/glued correctly, or it was so badly constructed in the first place that it couldn't survive the shipping all that well. I was expecting the TV to not turn on or work, but to my surprise it turned right on and started up perfectly. It still has the slight wobble in the screen if it is moved, but based on the fact that it still works correctly, I don't know if this one TV just happened to be damaged, or if it is just the way that it is made. Regardless I had to deduct a star for this reason.Quirk number two is a little more technical. I have my tv hooked up directly to my computer through HDMI and I was running my 2.1 sound system directly to the computer. Now that I have my cable and XBox hooked up to the TV as well, that setup no longer worked. So I hooked my RCA cables (Red and White) from the subwoofer (Built in amp) to the tv to make all audio run through the speakers. Then I had to turn off the TV speakers. So far so good. Then I changed the tv from fixed volume input to variable, so that I could control the volume with the TV remote instead of the speaker knobs themselves. Afterwords, everything was working correctly, I thought. Then I noticed that the sub was not producing any sound. Come to find out, with the setting on variable, the TV was not sending the low pass signals to the sub like it is suppose to. I called Vizio to find out what I could do to fix the issue. They said I needed to use optical output to make it work correctly, so I got a converter, and of course the same issue was happening. I ended up just switching back to the fixed input and just manually change the volume when I switch over to the cable or XBox.All in all, the TV is a really good TV. The smart apps were pretty lackluster, but I never use them so it doesn't bother me, but if you want to stream Netflix or Hulu Plus or some other service, then consider getting another TV. If not, then for the price this TV is a great choice.Also, a lot of people were complaining that the color was terrible when they first turned it on, and that they had to go through all these different adjustments to get it bearable, but when I first turned on my TV, I didn't think the color was that bad, and within 5 minutes of playing with the options, I was able to get it like I wanted. So unless you are a TV buff, you shouldn't really notice any issues.

Reviews.Title: A very happy gamer.
Reviews.Author: Civildude
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality.  I use it mostly for console gaming and there I don't notice any input lag.  Everything shows up and my new console was able to quickly pick up the tv settings so that I can get the tv to turn off and on when the console does.  I could not have asked for a better 55" set.This TV set was absolutely perfect for the price.

Reviews.Title: good, but wild colors
Reviews.Author: andrew zakrzewski
Reviews.Content: the machine looks good and sets up nicely.I haven't experimented with the smart features like the wifi connection.what I don't like so much is the quality of the color.  I contacted vizio customer support and they instructed me to reset the thing to factory-default settings, but I find the colors too garish and psychedelic-like, especially the blue and the purple.  I rolled back the blue-gain all the way to zero and experimented with the blue offset from one end of the spectrum to the other, and rolled back the color saturation to a low level, but (I think) I still get too much blue.maybe these LED screens work better out in the back yard to watch the ball game, but mine is indoors in a darkened room and the colors are just too strident.  Maybe it will break-in after a while or i'll get used to it, hey?

Reviews.Title: Overall Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kathy Noffsinger
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this has been the best experience I have ever had in ordering anything online. I have never ordered something this expensive before so I definitely had a few doubts. I ordered this TV on a Sunday and received it today, Wednesday.....So it took three days to receive this. Set up was easy and the entire experience was fantastic. The picture quality is very good and I do not have any issues with the sound. Setting up the internet was easy also. This is a great TV for the price ! I would also like to advise anyone using CEVA for delivery that you need to go to their website and check tracking since you will need to contact them to set up delivery of your item. In the lower left of the screen it will tell you they sent an email or waiting for customer action. By contacting them you can avoid any delays in your merchandise.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Felix Yin
Reviews.Content: I got this for thanksgiving and just got chance to watch them recently. This TV is clear and its apps are nice too. You can watch Amazon Prime videos using the app that came with the TV, and you can also sync the Youtube videos you are watching on your phone or tablet with the TV. Very nice purchase. I wouldn't recommend people buying some real expansive TV because each every year the technology is improving and you will be crying if your expansive investment is broken and without a warranty.

Reviews.Title: NO SMOOTH MOTION EFFECT, DON'T BUY.
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: I'm annoyed that this TV doesn't offer the "smooth motion effect" settings. Don't expect to get that smooth playback even with the 120hz. For that I give one star. That feature alone takes away from quality IMO. For a 2013 model this is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Bright, Vivid display, slow shipping
Reviews.Author: C. Graves
Reviews.Content: Love the TV, only downfall is sometimes Amazon prime crashes. I would imagine that eventually an application update might fix this error. Other than that the TV looks great. This is my third Vizio TV. Great performance for the price.

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good - Remote Too Small
Reviews.Author: Silverfox229 "Silverfox"
Reviews.Content: Have had this set for a week. The biggest gripe I have is the remote. It is too small, buttons are too small and close to each other (because it is too small) and no backlighting for the remote buttons. Have to turn on an ambient light to see the remote buttons to navigate. I am continuously hitting a neighbor key (fat-fingers), or sliding off a key to hit a key next to the original one I selected. Very annoying. I want a GIANT remote with GIANT, BACKLIT buttons.I did have to replace my first set. After 14 hours of perfect picture, the picture turned into the look that you have with old-fashioned color film negatives. I called Vizio, they asked for a photo, which I furnished. They said I had a lemon and was unfixable and could send another set to arrive in 7-10 days. Since I just bought the set at Walmart three days earlier, I said no, thanks and exchanged it at Walmart. No questions asked.But, other than that, I am pleased with my replacement set so far. I set my settings starting with Calibrated settings and then moved backlighting to 75%. That works fine for me; my viewing room is pretty dark. The Smart TV feature isn't what I thought it would be. It presents more options for more gateways to web-based presentations or streaming than I got from my old Sony Blue-Ray gateways. (Example, many local tv and weather news "channels" for various spots around the country. So, I may eventually find them useful. Netflix and Hulu have one less button to push and you don't have to turn on the Blue-Ray to get your wifi going, as the wifi in Vizio is on all the time the router is up.I was pleasantly surprised that you can see the signal strength of sources & channels if you hit the Source button, wherever you are. Found that Fox, ESPN, History, and ABC channels (and their affiliates) are 720p and all other tv channels are 1080i; whereas netflix and blue-ray are 1080p. So, I learned something new. Found out that TV broadcasters don't plan to upgrade their broadcast strength for a long time into the future, which is interesting. And, movies aren't going to increase their current 24 frames per second soon, either. Oh well, that's not a Vizio problem, but it is interesting that Vizio makes that info available to the viewer.PS I paid $698 (before sales tax) on 05/04/2014 at Walmart for this set.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Marc Calderone
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  Setup was super easy, and the apps run very easily as well.  I mostly watch HD local channels with an HD Antenna, and Netflix.

Reviews.Title: I could not be more pleased overall with my experience with my Vizio TV thus far.
Reviews.Author: Kiso
Reviews.Content: Considering this model TV cost under the average of two month's car payments I will get years of satisfaction from this TV.  Useable Apps, NAS streaming support, built-in WiFi (HUGE unexpected bonus) and extending my livingroom TV viewing experience even further with crisp full HD picture that looks fantastic once you've tweaked some of the picture settings.I did not expect a budget minded upgrade to be so appreaciated.  Vizio has earned a contenders position in the TV game after what they've been releasing product wise. I have no idea how their customer support is but I do think it should be apart of scoring items such as these so without experiencing the anarchy companies CAN put you through to warranty something I'm only basing my stars on the following categories:All 5 Star-Price-Quality-Buyer Satisfaction-Ease of Use-Available Technologies-Shipping Quickness-Ease of Setting Up-Ease/Use of the Remote Control

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: David J Nagel
Reviews.Content: Very clear picture and rich color. The ability to jump right to Netflix (or a dozen other similar apps) at the push of a button is nice too. The sound quality is great and doesn't leave me wanting if I don't turn on the surround system. Also fun to stream YouTube videos right from my phone on the wifi.

Reviews.Title: Not working for Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Jake Esau
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV primarily to act as a monitor for my media center computer, but also wanted it to directly stream amazon prime as it's somewhat cumbersome to do on the computer without a mouse (I just use a wireless keyboard to control it).  Unfortunately, getting Amazon instant video to work is somewhat tricky.  The remote has an Amazon button which I still have yet to get to work properly (sometimes it doesn't work at all, sometimes it takes 30+ seconds to respond).  You can also get to it by pressing the big V button, but then you have to scroll through the apps to get to Amazon which is a very slow process.My mother has a 70" Vizio TV that is similar to this one aside from the size that doesn't have these issues.  I checked that my firmware is up to date.Short version:If you want to use this just as a monitor or TV connected to another box, it will work greatIf you plan on heavily using the smart features, you might put out a bit more money for a better model

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E550i-A0 55-Inch 1080p
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I weren't prepared for how vivid the images are.  It's like you're looking at a TV for the first time in your life.  Really!

Reviews.Title: TV

Reviews.Content: The tv is good but so are a lot of them. Knocked my socks off with Amazon's white glove delivery!!!! Brought it in- opened it up-checked for any damage- put on the base-put it where I desired- moved the old tv- made sure new tv worked- then took away all the packing etc.Sweet!

Reviews.Title: Thinking about buying this TV? Do it... do it now
Reviews.Author: Sam Karozos
Reviews.Content: Absolutely phenomenal TV. Extremely easy to set up and just an absolute dream when it comes to use and viewing.  I'm in love with it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, a problem getting Wifi to work, but have a solution
Reviews.Author: Gregory W. Hart "Gregory (Papa G)"
Reviews.Content: I like all the features for the price of this TV. I had a problem with the WiFi though. After numerous online chats with the prompt and competent tech support on the Vizio website, it was determined that somehow the TV IP address was getting blocked, although the router I use was never setup to block anything. I purchased a DLINK Range Extender unit (DAP-522) from Amazon. This unit sits behind the TV and receives the 5 GHz WiFi signal in my home, the units' Ethernet output connects to the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tim Harrington "Gadget Guru"
Reviews.Content: I bought it on sale on black Friday and it was a great deal. It's a smart TV that does most everything you'd like it to do. The only negative is that the colors wash out as your viewing angle moves to the side.

Reviews.Title: Great tv

Reviews.Content: Have had it for about 2 months after scoring one on black friday sale, love the tv.  It is a little slow to respond sometimes so it gets -1 star for that, but thats it

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: chitownbidda
Reviews.Content: no problems so far picture is top notch sound is great very easy set up an the internet apps work very well.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the money
Reviews.Author: TJ Bell
Reviews.Content: Love the options and quality. I moved another Vizio upstairs and use this for my main TV viewing. Love the quality and the built in Apps. For the money, you can't beat it. The delivery also included set up, confirmation that it was working, and removal of the boxes. WOW!

Reviews.Title: Vizio makes some great electronic products
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV, great picture and no lack of features! I use the apps and USB features quite a bit. Just toss your movies or family videos (avi or mp4 format) on a thumb drive, select the 'Media' option  and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I really like the picture and the the size and the functionality of this tv but after 3 months the remote is not working.

Reviews.Author: John A "Jack"
Reviews.Content: We received & the box looked fine. When we opened it however, the frame was cracked. I price matched at Best Buy & picked up another one there. It's box was looked fine on the outside but when we opened it, the screen was cracked. 3rd one was good. The TV works well, good picture, nice smart TV features, nice remote, light weight, good price.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a Great TV
Reviews.Author: brewzer
Reviews.Content: I picked up the 55" model on Black Friday for a ridiculous deal. I am picky and had second thoughts about purchasing a Vizio TV considering all I own now are Samsung. The picture on this TV might not be quite as good as Samsung TVs but it isn't bad by any means. Considering I would have had to spend about another $1,000 on a comparable Samsung I am very pleased with the purchase.I used another reviewer's pictures settings to finely tune my TV. It looks good, but not quite as rich as the Samsung. There is no blurring or other distortions while watching live sports or gaming on my Xbox One (the lag input is good and makes this a more than adequate TV for gaming).The factory sound is just like any other LED/LCD TV and nothing more than adequate. I will be purchasing a sound bar for this TV soon enough.All of the Smart TV and DLNA features work perfectly with minimum fuss. It's just a solid TV all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, not 120Hz
Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this television for the price, it is direct backlit, but there is none of the bright spotting I've seen in other direct lit sets of lesser quality. That being said, this set feels premium in quality. The apps are good with snappy performance and quick startup times. The amount of picture adjustment that can be done is very impressive, and it was easy to fine tune the picture to look awesome. The bezel is thin and sleek.The only disappointment I have is that the set definitely does not run at 120 Hz. There is no frame repeating smoothing effect, and it appears to be running at 60 Hz. This was not a deal-breaker, but it should be noted for any potential buyers, and is certainly misrepresented by Vizio's advertising and spec sheet.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: kstamp
Reviews.Content: Got this for $479 on Thanksgiving during the Amazon Lightning deal.So far, no problems to report.  TV looks great, WiFi works, my Xbox games look amazing.Really enjoy watching sports on this with my dad, looking forward too watching the upcoming Olympics on it.  Football and Hockey are awesome.BTW, I am reviewing the 55 inch model.If you can get this for the right price, DO IT.  I haven't seen many Samsungs or Sonys, but considering they usually nearly cost double the price of a Vizio, I think this TV was a great buy. I really doubt a Samsung or Sony would have been much better in quality than this TV.Also, the delivery guy was really nice, he made sure the TV powered on, brought it into the room I wanted to put it in, and showed me how to attach the stand.  And that was a free bonus service.Thanks Amazon, Vizio, and Pilot (the package carrier.)

Reviews.Title: Superb

Reviews.Content: Grabbed it on a lightning deal at an awesome price. Great TV thus far. Actually got my siblings the same tv for christmas

Reviews.Author: Adam M Pierce
Reviews.Content: Pretty good tv for the money. The smart tv stuff like netflix, hulu, and YouTube is kind of slow when running on the wifi.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!

Reviews.Content: I had a Vizio 32" since 2007 and decided it was time to upgrade this past Black Friday and this tv had a great deal. I couldn't be happier. The picture is amazing, particularly the brights. The lows out of the box were terrible but after some tinkering it's better. Again couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: BEST LED HD SMART TV

Reviews.Content: This 55in SMART LCD HDTV has the best picture quality that I have see. Kn any other smart tv. The colors are so vivid and realistic. The remote control is smaller than my iPhone but has everything you need and it's very easy to operate. One button selection takes you to your internet sites amazon, Facebook, Netflix, just to name a few but the list of selection you can add us endless. Reviews.Title: Exellent
Reviews.Author: davi
Reviews.Content: This is a Great tv, even though it arrive late from the carrier it arrived in a perfect Package, not like the 50" seiki. This is a deal awesome tv, I have always bought vizio tv's and never had a problem with them they are great and well built. What can i say good buy

Reviews.Title: Vizio E550i-A0 55 Inch 1080p
Reviews.Author: Larry Li
Reviews.Content: Like many of the recent reviews, I got this on Black Friday for a significant discount. The Quality: Even though this is not a true 120hz, the quality of it is phenomenal! The size: The TV isn't fat nor super slim but right in the middle. The sound: It is above average compared to the my other HDTVs in my opinion but I still use surround sound for it. Here are the steps to hook up your surround sound:1. Vizio > Audio > TV Speakers: Click Off2. Vizio > Audio > Digital Audio Out: Click PCM or your choice3. Vizio > System > CEC > CEC Function > Click Enable4. Vizio > System > CEC > System Audio Control > Click On5. Vizio > System > CEC > Device Discovery > Your AV Device (Surround Sound Audio Receiver)The only CON I can think of is the remote. Many reviews here for the Vizio E550i-A0 but many do not discuss about the remote. The remote does not come with a keyboard or a slide out keyboard like other smart Vizio TVs, though I already knew that. However, the remote is GARBAGE which makes me want to take -1 star away from this HDTV. The lag is so significant it irritates me. One good example is that it takes a good 2-3 seconds to even turn the volume down or up one notch and etc. Compared to my other HDTVs, they barely take a millisecond to change a channel, volume, inputs, and etc. I do not know if it is the remote or something else. Does anyone know any fixes to this or does this effect you too? I will be forever in your debt if you solve this issue.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: ViciousXUSMC "ViciousXUSMC"
Reviews.Content: I am not a TV Snob I am however a technology enthusiast and very much more picky than the average person.  I pay attention to all the settings, color balance, black levels, white levels, dead pixels, and I would die to see a picture in a improper aspect ratio.I color matched my computer monitors and even sent 2 of them back due to color banding or a dead pixel so, yeah a bit picky...For my TV the important things for me was good viewing angles, and good black levels, and overall good quality on picture and colors.This TV surprised me with a picture quality I would never expect from a cheap brand name.  I have seen this brand before at a friends house and it looked horrible, but that was a much older TV, much cheaper (only 720P) and he probably never even tried to calibrate it.I ran 2 calibration disks on this and from there tweaked by eye to my preference.I manually turned off/on all the extra image processing features and when I was done, this thing looks great!My black levels are good enough that I can see anything I should in a dark movie setting, and my blacks look BLACK and my white levels while not as great are giving me a nice perfect looking white shade and overall coloration that makes me happy.For the money I paid for this it was a steal, and I only wanted it for the TV itself not any of the smart features that are also included.My largest + is that the image scaling on this TV is not just 1:1 or stretch, it also had a aspect ratio fill and that is perfect for SD content to make it fit my screen without distorting it.The largest - is that for some reason they do not have a VGA connection that I consider standard on any HDTV.  I also really didn't like the power cable connection.  I wish it was a standard 3 pin like computers and computer monitors use as they fit more secure and offer more protection than the 2 prong accessory style plug this uses.But this was my gift to myself and the family this year and its a present that we enjoy each and every day.  Has made movie time much more enjoyable and it has also preformed admirably as a computer monitor for gaming/movies off the PC.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: M. Williams "Mark"
Reviews.Content: This TV is one of two Vizio TV's I have. One is a 47 inch Razor smart tv from 2011, and now this one. Great picture when you adjust settings. The apps work great after the firmware is updated (at least for me) and I hate wireless. Both my TV's are LAN connected thanks to an ethernet switch behind both TV's. Sound isn't that great (get a sound bar). The equalizer option is shaded out so I'm guessing that's not available on this tv, but with a good sound bar, I don't care about that. Wish I could give more info but it seems to suit with fine with Directv HD. I LOVE THE YOUTUBE app! I use that all the time and it works so well on this TV (see question regarding that below)I do have a QUESTION for anyone who reads this review. The 47 inch razor and this E550i-A0 are both smart TV's with the same apps. The Razor TV's Youtube App isn't nearly as responsive as this app. It works, but navigation is very slow... Once you start playing the video's on the app, they play fine, it's the moving up, down, scrolling through videos that's a major difference from one tv to the other. I even cleared all memory on the Razor and deleted apps I never use, there aren't that many that I want honestly, but it's still slow navigation.....If anyone has any suggestion as to why it's slow navigation on one tv, but not the other, let me know.More about the Vizio Youtube app. I LOVE it and I'll tell you why! When it first came out, I didn't like it at all. But Vizio must have updated this. Now when you log into your youtube account on the Vizio app, you can see your uploads, your favorites, people you subscribe to and THEIR playlists! You can rate videos, or subscribe to a channel etc. This Youtube app can do so much more than the youtube app on my panasonic bluray player. I just wish the one on the razor TV was more responsive when navigating.Conclusion: I've had Vizio TV's since 2006. The one this tv replaced was almost 6 years old with no issues. I just wanted to upgrade and the other TV was given to someone and still working.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic visuals and incredible value
Reviews.Author: Sicom
Reviews.Content: Despite reading countless reviews in my gauntlet of television research, the picture quality of this television impressed and surprised. The colors are extremely vivid and blacks are dark. Video is crisp and clean. Sound quality is alright. You won't hear a lot of detail and no deep bass, but the speakers are average at worst. There are several input/output hookups, including 4 HDMI, but only one set of components.The Vizio applications are hit and miss:Netflix works great. The UI is easy to navigate and has most of the standard features you'd expect from Netflix.Amazon Instant Video is functional but leaves a lot to be desired.The M-GO application is now functional, and the UI is slick.Pandora works great, but wasn't pre-installed on my TV.I briefly tried some of the others, but they were unimpressive.It's worth noting that the Vizio app interface isn't as quick and snappy as one might hope, but it gets the job done. The interface is also customizable to an extent.It's hard to argue any shortcomings of this television. What this television does well is deliver incredible value, perhaps even unmatched value. A minor gripe and slight oddity is the remote control that comes with the 55" and below screens is is not the QWERTY-flip remote. However, that remote can be bought separately for about $10 (and it works fabulously) right here on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Jane A.
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my little dinky TV with a new, nice one. I thought I would be looking at 39"-42" TVs. Then I went and saw a bunch at a good distance. Realized I should be looking larger. Now, the 42" I was originally looking at was a VIZIO, and my little dinky one was as well. So I began looking at larger TVs but was obviously a little biased.This TV was the right size, at a great price. The picture looks great and it was fairly easy to set up.My only real issue is with Amazon's shipping service. I scheduled the TV to arrive between 3 and 5pm so that I didn't need to take a full day off of work. The guy calls around 4:20 and tells me he's going to be late. He arrived at around 5:20. I was pissed because I had left work hours before I needed to, and had to drive 300 miles that night to another state. It was inconvenient to say the least.

Reviews.Author: Jim Jennings
Reviews.Content: I bought this Vizio 55" smart TV after researching all of the major brands and models (Sony, Samsung, Sharp, LG, etc.). After traveling to numerous stores to see the actual TVs and picture quality, I chose this wonderful TV that equaled and often bettered the name brands at, in many cases, half the price or less. Setup from box to live only took five minutes. The wi-fi connection was a breeze and now I can watch my Baylor Bears Football with amazing size and clarity. This model replaced my 50" Sony. Given the price, quality and options, I will take Vizio over all of them!

Reviews.Title: Great Quality for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Megan Vinciguerra
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Great price. Great quality! IT'S JUST SO BIG! Especially for a TV under $700 (at least it was when I bought it!).  The only cons I have are that the apps are a little laggy. Pressing the 'Vizio' button on the remote takes a few tries before the smart apps come up. Also, the Hulu App is ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE! The user interface is pretty average, but most videos have odd load times when the same video on the Netflix or Amazon Prime app loads completely fine. Very odd indeed.  Only one other issue, which I'm not quite sure how it happened...but it looks like on the right side of the TV there's a bend in the screen as if it were made of paper. It's hard to explain, but basically the image is slightly distorted on the edge of the right side. Possibly I'll see if I can get something done with the warranty, but it's not too distracting as long as you're not watching at an angle from the left!But all that said, the quality really rivals similar models in top competitors like Samsung. Great picture quality, and even though there are a few bugs...still totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: Vizio blew this one, not smart and barely HD unless HD means "Horrible Display"
Reviews.Author: aldridgec
Reviews.Content: This TV was not a good value. I immediately noticed that the picture quality was poor, despite several good reviews. The biggest problem I had with this set, is that there was purple ghosting following moving subjects, especially people. This seemed to be most aggregated when light skinned people were over a dark background.The viewing angle on this TV is terrible. Just a little off to either side, or above, and the colors shift and desaturate severely. The 120hz was a joke, it had no settings for motion smoothing, and I could see no difference compared to my 7 year old LG TV.As far as features, it did have a lot of built in Apps and a decent interface, but the processing was slow. I often resorted to my Playstation or ChromeCast instead.I did not realize the "E" series was meant for economy. I thought I had done my due diligence reading reviews but apparently those owners were not nearly as picky as me, or they were just blind. I suspect in reality, they upgraded from either a smaller set, or a non HD TV and did not notice the problems over impressively large display. During the ordeal of trying to figure out the "problem" (which there was none, it was by design), I visited a local Best Buy that had the set and noticed it was the same, and much worse than surrounding sets.I do have to say, Amazon 30 day tech support was fabulous. Much better than Vizio's own tech line. Vizio kept insisting I send still pictures of the problem or try to get a video of it and denied any such problem. I know it's a real issue as I did find one other review that indicated that they noticed the purple hazing. Eventually they agreed to refund the purchase, as they "no longer had the TV in stock." I suspect that Amazon with their suppliers have some creative marketing with how they list items, as this TV was not listed as being sold by Amazon before the lightning deal started, nor after it was over, only during the sale.I was very disappointed, as I purchased this TV on a black Friday lighting deal. I was not a good value, and all my effort to get the deal, was in vain as all Amazon could understandably do was refund my money.The return process was a little cumbersome, as the courier CEVA, never showed up when they were supposed to. Both times, with delivery and return pickup, they came at 9 am. I work late at night and sleep in, I had set the appointment for the afternoon. They did not give me a call before they arrived either, the return pickup driver was lucky I put pants on to sign the paper work!

The picture quality is awesome, the refresh rate is where it needs to be(120htz), and if you are a Netflix junky like myself, then it could not be any easier to use. You pick up the remote, hit the big red "Netflix" button. The end. You tube works great as well.

Reviews.Content: I have one of these...2 years old. No remotes will work with it  after only 2 years. Vizio wants me to pay $275 to fix it. BUYER BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: Vizio owes me hours of my life wasted on this tv
Reviews.Author: Banjo "AK user"
Reviews.Content: Background:  Bought Panasonic plasma early 11/13 for primary tv for watching sports/movies/tv.  Bought Vizio at Sams Club Black Friday to be a tv to watch news in the morning, tv while cooking dinner and kids to play video games on.  Vizio to be wired connection, Panasonic wireless.  Also bought vizio soundbar.  First problem: Would turn tv speaker off to use soundbar and every time I turned tv on, tv speaker would be back on.  Ok, not how it is supposed to work but I can deal with small step each time.  Picture was ok, not great, but it worked.  Apps functioned fine.  Then remote stopped working, then picture and sound problems.  Sometimes picture w/o sound, sometimes vice versa.  Called vizio customer service numerous times.  Americans that can be reached anytime is good but they were not helpful.  Over and over again, unplug this, hold this for 30 seconds, reset this, take batteries out and push buttons, clear memory, unplug, repeat, rinse, wash... Rep told me problems with interference on my network.  Solution turn file sharing off, unplug this from router, unplug that.  Me: but I want to use file share, that crap is plugged in for reason.  Them: You have problem with network.  Me:  Vizio tv has problem with my network, Panasonic works just fine.  More calls, more troubleshooting.  Finally I say no more troubleshooting and they ask one more time then we will send replacement if it does not work.  Try, fail, vizio sends email for replacement asking for copy of receipt.  Email copy of receipt.  Get email to call customer service.  Customer service, let's try some troubleshooting.  I unload on some poor smuck stuck working for vizio, take tv back to Sam's Club and buy LG.  Have not set up the LG yet but hopefully it works or, I am going to have to throw down for another Panasonic.Update:  I ended up buying LG 50LN5700 and so far it works perfectly.  I am not sure if the Vizio I got was a lemon, or if Vizio's are just very sensitive to a typical network setup but I now have smart tv's by Panasonic and LG that work perfectly in a situation where Vizio would not work.  Picture is much better on the LG as well.

Reviews.Title: Defective Item
Reviews.Author: Herb
Reviews.Content: Item was defective and had to be returned. Only displayed Vizio logo and did have any picture although hooked up to cable. Required 3 service calls to confirm item was defective.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted and expected
Reviews.Author: Jack Huisman
Reviews.Content: I didn't want all the bells and whistles.  I only wanted two things in the TV and I got them.This is a 55" high-definition (1080p)LED TV with built-in Amazon Prime and Netflix streaming.  There are a couple other features  available (hulu, vudu(?)) that I haven't gotten to, but I don't use them yet.Set up was trivial, Picture is great.  Price under $700, delivered. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Got it on Lightning Deal
Reviews.Author: Freedom
Reviews.Content: For $479 on Thanksgiving Day, no tax and free two-day shipping I absolutely love it. I was lucky enough to be looking at it Thanksgiving afternoon when it went on Lightning Deal. The picture is really good but I had an old school TV so it's a huge difference. I really like the "Smart" part. I love to watch YouTube videos and Amazon Prime movies, play music, videos and picture slideshows from my laptop. From time to time (normally after extended play) the wireless connection will hang and I have to power cycle the TV to get it working again.But, it doesn't happen often. You can control YouTube from your smart phone or search for videos using the remote (the 55" doesn't have the qwerty keyboard) but I've found it is easier to use my laptop and add videos to "playlists" on YouTube. The playlists show up on the TV and it is easier to select them. Very happy with my TV. PS. I bought the Vizio sound bar with sub woofer which really improves the sound. Love it too. It has Bluetooth so I can play songs from my smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Not a good sports TV
Reviews.Author: Mike White
Reviews.Content: The refresh rate on this is not 120, that is misleading.. Picture is good for movies and such but as far as watching sports it is a waste of money. Saved for almost a year to get a new upgrade, went out on Black Friday to Sam's club and purchased it.. The Vizio apps are slow and seem very outdated. Not happy at all with it..

Reviews.Title: Terrible Viewing from the Side
Reviews.Author: Peeps
Reviews.Content: I purchased the E550i-A0 from another seller and was immediately turned off by how bad the tv looks from the side. Even when sitting 12 feet away, you can see the colors degrade instantly while moving a little to the side. With a 30 degree angle, the brightness goes way up and all definition is lost, the yellows and magentas stand out, but everything else approaches white. Vizio support was no help and said this was normal. Looks like I will keep my 8yr old Samsung for a while longer...

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Jeri Carlisle
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV and I absolutely LOVE VIZIO. All of the televisions I own are VIZIO and I have never had one problem with any of them.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Anton
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of comments and watching some video reviews, I decided to go with the 55" Vizio E5501-A0. Overall, it's a great TV for the price. You can't really compare it to a high-end Samsung or Sony LED TV. But for the price, this is an excellent option. It has a very good picture and a great selection of internet apps, like Netflix and Amazon Video. The only potential downside is the picture settings. It took me about 15 minutes to adjust all the  video settings to my liking. Not a big deal for me, but it might be an issue for someone who's not that tech-savvy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Great Value
Reviews.Author: Heavy C
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed.  This TV has a great picture, pretty darn good sound even without the Vizio sound bar I subsequently hooked up, and I really like all the smart apps that are so easy to use.  I'm very satisfied and will be purchasing a 60" version of this same model very soon.

Reviews.Title: Sound and other buttons stopped working
Reviews.Author: Matthew Tidball
Reviews.Content: After 1 month sound and all buttons stopped working.  Have to power off and reset tv .  Even that has stopped working.  Doesnt work on remote or tv.

Reviews.Title: TV arrived broken - twice, but great customer service
Reviews.Author: Marcus Francis
Reviews.Content: The first TV show up not turning on. Customer service was great about having FedEx picking it up and sending out replacement one not too long after. The second one arrived like it had been hit on the screen as when I turned it on, was a shattering of pixels. Not fun. Again, customer service didn't hesitate to full refund me my money and have the TV picked up from my doorstep by FedEx. If the customer service wasn't as great and fast in responding, this would have gotten one star. Ended up just getting the exact same TV for slightly cheaper at Walmart.

Reviews.Title: Love this tv!
Reviews.Author: Derrick A Whelan
Reviews.Content: Vizio 55 inch led lcd has an amazing picture and the smart tv feature is awesome! I'm glad I didn't pass this tv up!

Reviews.Title: Definitely a great choice
Reviews.Author: seth
Reviews.Content: It's really clear an easy to use! I don't get the "live show" effect. It's really smooth and looks great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!!
Reviews.Author: Yusuf Shabazz
Reviews.Content: Works great! The 120Hz is excellent and there's no motion blur when I'm gaming or watching tv, Netflix, etc. Also the setup was as simple and easy as it could get.

Reviews.Title: Thick. Smelled like burnt electronics out of the box for about a week.
Reviews.Author: Dabbler
Reviews.Content: This Tv is ok.  It's about the same thickness as a lcd tv with a CCFL backlight. Semi-glossy screen.  I have it wall mounted in a bedroom, so these things don't bother me that much.The TV smelled really bad out of the box.  The only other time I've noticed anything this bad smelling was when I bought a refurbished bluray player, and I assumed it was due to the manufacturer having to do some soldering repairs on it.  When I got the tv box open, I was afraid there was something wrong with the set, due to the extremely strong smell, but it worked fine.  The full strength of the smell went away after about a week, but I can still smell traces of it at times even today (after about a month later).  Not very pleasant having to sleep through the smell in the bedroom (hazardous?).Image quality is ok.  I have a Sharp 60" led edge lit lcd tv from costco, and the image quality on that set is slightly better (but it also cost me 3x's as much).  I tried to make adjustments to the settings, but ended up just going with the factory settings after some fiddling.The only app I use on the tv is youtube, and it works.  The UI to access the app is not very friendly IMO.  Instead of just selecting the app to launch directly, you have to select it, go through some popup preview, and then navigate down to launch the app (~ over 5 button presses instead of 1 or 2).  It does load slightly faster than my ~2 year old sharp tv, so I'm guessing it has a faster processor.There's some bug when I try to pair my android device to control the youtube app, where it either completely fails to pair or ends up rebooting the app several times before it syncs.  It's a little quirky with my other tv sometimes as well, but not as bad as the vizio.  It does end up working eventually (through app reboots on one or both devices), but it's kind of a pain to have to wait for the two devices to figure out how to play nicely together.  On the bright side, once paired, it's fantastic.There's also a unicorn carrying a magic pot of chocolate bunnies that flies out from the screen, leaving behind a colorful flower rainbow trail in your room when you tap the edges of the set in a konami code pattern.  The bunnies are great, but I mean, really, what's a guy supposed to do with all those flowers?  Dislike.  I kid. I kid.  ... those flowers make great decorations.In summary, if you want a relatively cheap, thick, smelly, smart (insert obese celebrity reference here), decent looking tv, buy it...and NO, there's no unicorns!  that was a joke.  (you know there's always *one* guy... 'i bought this because he told me there was a unicorn'])

Reviews.Title: Super T.V
Reviews.Author: D'Queenbee
Reviews.Content: This T.V is awesome and I would recommend it to others. The picture and sound quality is awesome, and it was shipped out very quickly, neatly packaged.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Nick Flickinger
Reviews.Content: Solid price, great TV.  4 HDMI ports, wifi works great.  My only qualm is I wish visio would get hbogo on their app store.

Reviews.Title: Visio 55" tv
Reviews.Author: kenneth "ken"
Reviews.Content: The sound is incredible but if you do not sit right in front of the tv it appears washed out and distorted.

Reviews.Title: Good buy.
Reviews.Author: Curt Rapp
Reviews.Content: Decent tv for the price and having the internet apps is a real bonus.  I am disappointed in the limited picture control and calibration.  The black level can't be directly adjusted and there are limited options for color control.  I am going to get calibration disc to see if that helps.

Reviews.Title: Really good
Reviews.Author: Andrew Barajas
Reviews.Content: Looked around and found this to be the best for the price.  I love it clear picture and sound is great.  This is my second Vizio for the house.

Reviews.Title: Vizio e5501 AO  Sound problems solved
Reviews.Author: Donald Stephens
Reviews.Content: I just set up this Vizio E5501 AO today. The price was great for a 55 inch smart tv, and the picture good, but the volume kept dropping and rising by itself.  I have ATT Uverse and found out that I could assign volume control to the ATT DVR box by pressing the ATT button and the OK button at the same time, then entering code 955, then hitting enter. The standard method to program the cable remote didn't work. So far this has fixed the volume issue. I was about to bring the TV back, but am pleased with the TV now and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: beautiful screen
Reviews.Author: buy smart
Reviews.Content: Beautiful screen, smart tv. side is amazing. Definitely worth connecting to the internet. I compared this tv to some other name brands and am glad I went with this option

Reviews.Title: Makes a great computer monitor.
Reviews.Author: M. Ruhland "Wholehawg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a few months ago because it had great reviews and on a whim I decided to hook it up to my PC and try it for gaming.  WOW!  I have hooked several flat screen LCD TVs to my computer and this one blows them all away.  Most of the time you get that over sharp hard edge to everything but with this rig its was a very refined and smooth picture with little to no adjustment.  The only thing I could say is because its a TV and only 120Hz the refresh rate is a little below the 6-8ms GTG your going to get on a good quality HD monitor but its not anything that makes a huge difference.  I mostly play World of Warcraft and Rise of Flight and it performs great for both of those games.  If your looking for a really big monitor consider this as an option.

Reviews.Title: Pay a little bit more for a better TV
Reviews.Author: UCFKnightmare
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product since it was such a steal at under $700 w/ the smart features.  I received the TV and was not pleased at all with the resolution or the smart apps.  I ended up paying a little more ($300) for a 58 Panasonic and I noticed an IMMEDIATE difference in the picture quality.  This was my first and will be my last VIZIO purchase.

Reviews.Title: Cracked screen when it arrived
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: I have Amazon Prime which includes enhanced delivery for this product. The delivery sheet states that it's a 2 man delivery. There was only one person. It was supposed to be unboxed, plugged in, and turned on. None of this was done. He set it down, had me sign for it, and left. I had to unbox it and when I turned it on the screen was cracked. I will never order anything like this from Amazon again. It's much better to go to a local store. I'm also probably going to cancel my Prime membership. I have to do it by next Thursday to not be billed. I just want to make sure it won't affect this return. I've been extremely happy with Amazon up to this point. Unfortunately it only takes one incident like this. I do apologize for the fact this isn't actually a product review but I'm very upset that I had to waste a vacation day to sit and wait for a broken tv. The delivery company was Pilot Freight Services.Edit: After reading some of the comments I wanted to add this edit in a more calm manner. Amazon normally does a very good job at least for me in the past. I feel they may have dropped the ball on this. I've been a prime member for several years and it's coming up for renewal. They may have offered to give me the next year free. It's not a big cost to them and and it probably would have appeased me more for having to waste a vacation day. Do they really owe me anything, of course not but sometimes customer service is about making the customer happy when the company does something wrong. And since it was delivered in a broken condition they choose the carrier so it's their fault until the product is opened and turned on for the first time. And I think that rather than me having to take another day off they should insist that the package is picked up either Mon-Fri after 4:30 PM or on a Saturday. I think the main thing I want people to realize is that for deliveries of products such as this you may be inconvenienced several times. Probably not since I'm sure most deliveries go smoothly but I thought mine would go smoothly also and here I am.Edit# 2: I talked to Amazon Customer Service on Sat Sept 21 to see if we might be able to come to an arrangement. Customer Service was great and part of the arrangement was that the bad tv would be picked up when the new one is delivered. They are also going to see if it can be delivered either after 4 PM during the week or sometime on a Saturday which would be great.Edit# 3: This is my final edit. I received the television today a little after 4 PM. Amazon and Pilot were amazing in taking care of the issue. Kings Express was a little harder to deal with but finally gave in and delivered it after 4 PM so I wouldn't have to take more time off. I think the picture is great. I'm not a great tv critic but while watching some shows I was amazed at the blue of their eyes. We watched a show on Amazon Prime and it was nice. Didn't have any issues with it. It was streaming through cat-5. I like the fact that you have the Amazon Prime button on the remote. The cable box was a little trickier. I haven't gotten a digital box from the cable company yet so during the setup I was picking the cable box but finally figured out I had to pick cable coming straight from wall. The sound is a bit hard to make out since the speakers are in the bottom of the tv pointing down. Eventually I'll get a receiver and speakers for better sound but for now it's fine. So the 2 star downgrade is for the delivery and sound. The main reason I feel so strongly about the delivery is that maybe 90% of the people have a flawless delivery and no issues with the product. But for the people that do have a problem it is a little more involved than buying this at a local store and having them deliver it on a Saturday when you're off.

Reviews.Title: A total disaster.
Reviews.Author: john n broadfoot
Reviews.Content: I have had two of these T.V. sets delivered already and this TV is nothing but junk. Do not buy!!!! Amazon customer service isn't any better.

Reviews.Title: Vizio M3d550SL Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So I bought the vizio 55in 3d smart tv, was fine except for issues with the input sometimes loading Netflix and vudu. A month out of warranty started to see lines in the TV. 24 hrs later the tv is all lines now you can not see any picture.. Called vizio, they didn't even bother to say they could fix it. They refused to help at all. Said I was SOL on the tv and I should buy another one.I have never had a TV go out after a year of use. I will never buy a Vizio again.

Reviews.Title: no comparison
Reviews.Author: zoey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV online at Amazon after looking at other TV's in person with the same make up. When I got the TV I was disappointed in picture quality. It is not near as crisp and clear as samsung or sony or even LG. I should have gotten samsung. It looks like a small photo that you tried to make to large and is fuzzy.Also dissatisfied about the"smart" capability.  I thiught u would be able to go onto the internet and search things or check email but you cannot get google you are locked into yahoo and only the apps vizio provides AND if yiu do make use of the apps...like facebook..I trued that and was sadly disappointed that it did not fill the screen it is just a small pic on the side :(

Reviews.Title: The VIA features and delivery are not so good, otherwise good.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First, the scheduled delivery was anything but. 3 hours late, no phone call or other notification. I called CEVA at an hour and a half late and was promised the driver would contact me with an updated timetable. He didn't. (Update: he did call my work number and leave a message, not sure why.)  Luckily I took the whole day off instead of just the promised window or I would have returned it. Don't count it on it being there within the promised delivery window. It was easy enough to screw the stand onto it and plug the cables in, although the recessed area for the HDMI, LAN, etc. is not wide enough and you have to put a pretty sharp bend in all the cables if you want to have the TV flush against the wall. After turning it on, the setup app locked up twice and I had to unplug the TV to restart it. Early on there is a registration screen asking for email, town, etc. Surprise, there is no apparent way to enter text with the remote so I entered 5s for everything. Later I managed to get the answer of of Vizio's online chat support after navigating the Spanish Inquisition of registration and scripted support jail: click the OK button in the text box to bring up the on-screen keyboard. This tip comes in handy when activating the Netflix app and some other features. Possibly Vizio has a note in their support database about a crabby customer named Mr 55555 55555.But, since I got everything up and working it has been good for the price. The screen is crisp and clear, I like the smart dimming feature, it works well for me since there is a sliding door right next to the screen, I used to have to close the curtain to watch when there was sunlight coming in.

Reviews.Title: Got this on black friday for $480 on an amazon lightening deal
Reviews.Author: David Zuckerman
Reviews.Content: Works well.  I don't use the special features.  Takes a few seconds for it to turn on but no biggie; most tvs are like that.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo Lopez
Reviews.Content: the sound is garbage, the apps take for ever to load even for a beefy 50mps. one month into the purchase and tv begins turning off and restarting, what the hell !! suddenly it decides to go on strike, oh and the square trade warranty sucks as well. contacted them and instead of helping they said the manufacture should deal with this, why the hell did I pay for extra protection if its no gonna work.garbage all around, sorry vizio you disappointed me big for the first time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Waleed Alghamdi
Reviews.Content: I did not get the remote control that comes with the keyboard in the back!! All my friends got that!

Reviews.Title: Broken right in the box
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I bought this smart tv for a larger screen. When it arived at my door a WEEk later the back inside of the screen was CRACKED AND BROKEN! I was so mad. Very bad shipping quality. The tv its self tis amazing. Just hate the shipping
